pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.2: At this time Venerable Udāyī knew that the Buddha had prohibited sitting alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for action, and so instead he sat alone in private with the same girl. When they were able, they just chatted; otherwise he gave her a teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.3: A second time Visākhā had been invited to that family.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.4: When she arrived, she saw Udāyī sitting alone in private with the same girl,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.6: “Venerable, it’s not appropriate for you to sit alone with a woman on a private seat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.7: Although you may not be aiming at that act, people with little confidence are hard to convince.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.9: After leaving, Visākhā told the monks what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.11: “How can Venerable Udāyī sit alone with a woman on a private seat?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.12: After rebuking Udāyī in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.13: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you sat alone with a woman on a private seat?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.16: “… Foolish man, how can you sit alone with a woman on a private seat?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.18: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.19.1: ‘Although a seat is not concealed, nor suitable for action, it may be suitable for speaking indecently to a woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.20: If a monk sits alone with a woman in private on such a seat, and a trustworthy female lay follower sees him
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.21: and accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.22: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these two
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.23: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.1: Although a seat is not concealed:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.2: it is not concealed by a wall, a screen, a door, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.4: one is not able to have sexual intercourse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.5: It may be suitable for speaking indecently to a woman:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.6: one is able to speak indecently to a woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.10: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.14: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.18: just the monk and the woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.20: there is private to the eye and there is private to the ear.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.22: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.24: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.26: the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.27: The woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.28: Both are seated or both are lying down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.30: she has attained the fruit, she has broken through, she has understood the Teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.32: she has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.1: She accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.2: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these two
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.3: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.4: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.5: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.6: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.7: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.8: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.10: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t make physical contact,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.11: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.13: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.15: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.16: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.17: “I’ve seen you lying down, making physical contact with a woman,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.18: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.19: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t make physical contact,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.20: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.22: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.24: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.25: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.26: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while seated,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.27: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.28: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.29: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while seated,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.31: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t speak indecently,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.32: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.34: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.36: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.37: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.38: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while lying down,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.39: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.40: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t speak indecently,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.41: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.43: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.45: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.46: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.47: “I’ve seen you seated alone with a woman in private,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.48: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.50: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.52: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.53: If she accuses him like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.54: “I’ve seen you lying down alone with a woman in private,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.55: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.57: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.59: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.61: this is said with reference to the previous undetermined rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.63: not determined. It is either an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.1: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.2: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, yet he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.3: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, but he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.4: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.5: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.6: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, but he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.7: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, yet he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.8: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.9: The second undetermined offense is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.10: “Venerables, the two undetermined rules have been recited.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.11: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.23: The undetermined offenses have been well laid down
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.24: By the Stable One, the Buddha who is the best.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.25: The chapter on undetermined offenses is finished.
